title: Euro 1995 Ferrari F355 GTS 6-Speed
description: This 1995 Ferrari F355 GTS was produced for the German market and spent time in Ontario and Ohio prior to being purchased by the owner in 2023, and it now shows 55k kilometers (~34k miles). Powered by a 3.5-liter DOHC V8 linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential, it is finished in Rosso Corsa over black Connolly leather upholstery. The car has a gated shifter, a removable body-color targa top, a Capristo exhaust system, 18" five-spoke magnesium wheels, carbon-fiber door sill plates, a Continental stereo, and pop-up headlights. This F355 GTS is now offered on dealer consignment with a Carfax report and a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Euro 1995 Ferrari F355 GTS 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #170,986.
text: This 1995 Ferrari F355 GTS was produced for the German market and spent time in Ontario and Ohio prior to being purchased by the owner in 2023, and it now shows 55k kilometers (~34k miles). Powered by a 3.5-liter DOHC V8 linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential, it is finished in Rosso Corsa over black Connolly leather upholstery. The car has a gated shifter, a removable body-color targa top, a Capristo exhaust system, 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels, carbon-fiber door sill plates, a Continental stereo, and pop-up headlights. This F355 GTS is now offered on dealer consignment with a Carfax report and a clean Florida title. The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Rosso Corsa, and styling elements include a removable body-color roof panel as well as pop-up headlights, integrated front fog lights, flying buttress C-pillars, an integrated rear decklid spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, a vented engine cover, and air intakes on the doors and rocker panels. Paint protection film has been applied to the exterior, per the seller. The 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. Black-finished Ferrari-branded brake calipers are mounted over ventilated discs at each corner. A brake fluid flush was performed in preparation for the sale. The sport seats are trimmed in black Connolly leather and are joined by a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, carpets, and door panels. Carpeted floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include carbon-fiber door sill plates, a Continental stereo, a gated shifter, automatic climate control, and drilled aluminum pedals. The selling dealer notes that sticky buttons have been refinished. A cover on the passenger side of the dashboard has deformed. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 320-km/h speedometer, a 10k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure and coolant temperature. Ancillary instruments in the center stack include an analog clock and gauges for fuel level and oil temperature. The six-digit odometer shows 55k kilometers (~34k miles). The mid-mounted 3.5-liter DOHC V8 features five valves per cylinder and dry-sump lubrication for a factory-rated output of 375 horsepower and 268 lb-ft of torque. The selling dealer notes that an engine-out belt service was last completed in 2022. Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. A Capristo exhaust system has been fitted, and an oil change was performed in preparation for the sale. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. html:
This 1995 Ferrari F355 GTS was produced for the German market and spent time in Ontario and Ohio prior to being purchased by the owner in 2023, and it now shows 55k kilometers (~34k miles). Powered by a 3.5-liter DOHC V8 linked with a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential, it is finished in Rosso Corsa over black Connolly leather upholstery. The car has a gated shifter, a removable body-color targa top, a Capristo exhaust system, 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels, carbon-fiber door sill plates, a Continental stereo, and pop-up headlights. This F355 GTS is now offered on dealer consignment with a Carfax report and a clean Florida title.

The Pininfarina-designed body is finished in Rosso Corsa, and styling elements include a removable body-color roof panel as well as pop-up headlights, integrated front fog lights, flying buttress C-pillars, an integrated rear decklid spoiler, quad exhaust outlets, a vented engine cover, and air intakes on the doors and rocker panels. Paint protection film has been applied to the exterior, per the seller.

The 18″ five-spoke magnesium wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport tires. Black-finished Ferrari-branded brake calipers are mounted over ventilated discs at each corner. A brake fluid flush was performed in preparation for the sale.

The sport seats are trimmed in black Connolly leather and are joined by a color-coordinated dashboard, center console, carpets, and door panels. Carpeted floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include carbon-fiber door sill plates, a Continental stereo, a gated shifter, automatic climate control, and drilled aluminum pedals. The selling dealer notes that sticky buttons have been refinished. A cover on the passenger side of the dashboard has deformed.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a 320-km/h speedometer, a 10k-rpm tachometer, and gauges for oil pressure and coolant temperature. Ancillary instruments in the center stack include an analog clock and gauges for fuel level and oil temperature. The six-digit odometer shows 55k kilometers (~34k miles).

The mid-mounted 3.5-liter DOHC V8 features five valves per cylinder and dry-sump lubrication for a factory-rated output of 375 horsepower and 268 lb-ft of torque. The selling dealer notes that an engine-out belt service was last completed in 2022. Power is routed to the rear wheels via a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. A Capristo exhaust system has been fitted, and an oil change was performed in preparation for the sale.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

Filed under: 355
